newsitem.title: UK: NWE gas oil slips, premiums sag on lack of interes.
newsitem.headline: NWE gas oil slips, premiums sag on lack of interes.

text.p: NWE gas oil prices eased on underlying futures on Wednesday and lack of demand and mild weather squeezed premiums, traders said.
Nov IPE futures finished down $5 at $225.75 a tonne, dragged lower by NYMEX heating oil which saw some liquidation following bearish overnight API statistics.
Cargoes of winter grade (-7/-22) heating oil were bid at Nov IPE +3 and offered at +$4, $1 adrift from Tuesday. Russian was offered at Nov IPE +$1 and bid at Nov IPE flat to 50 cents.
Low sulphur diesel was talked at $23/26, $1 lower. Interest was absent because most traders have covered their October needs.
"The weather is fine today -- blue skies, no rain. Prices can't revive yet," one German trader added.

On barges, views varied on premiums in the absence of trades. Low sulphur winter grade (-7/-22) diesel was talked at $35, with intermediate (-3/-13) at Nov IPE +$33, some traders said. There was little buying interest and other players put winter grade in the low 30s.
"It's very difficult. It's listless out there," said another German trader. "It's still not cold enough to tempt people to buy oil."
